question.title: How to get specific vertices based on some filter using OrientDB Document API?
question.body:
I am trying to develop a java code to fetch particular vertices from OrientDB. As per document we can either fire a query or can use java document API to fetch vertices.

So, when I fire query "Select * from CityCars where CarName = 'ABC'"; this query returns vertex whose CarName is 'ABC' only.

but when I try to use below API as mentioned in the https://orientdb.dev/docs/3.2.x/java/Document-API-Documents.html#retrieving-documents.

for (ODocument cars : database.browseClass("CityCars")) {
   System.out.println(cars.field("CarName"));
}

This API returns all the vertices, and does not return vertices whose CarName is 'ABC' only.

Is there any way to use document API to fetch required vertices only i.e whose CarName is 'ABC', rather than fetching all the vertices?

answers.body:
There is no API that fetch and filter the documents directly, or better, the API is the query API

 try(OResultSet results = database.query("Select * from CityCars where CarName = 'ABC'")) {
   while(results.hasNext()) {
     // Getting it as element so it can be used to do updates.
     OElement element = results.next().getElement().get();
     System.out.println(cars.getProperty("CarName"));
  }
}

I hope this helps.
